title: Robert Downey Jr clashes with Hollywood exec before Howard Stern interview
text:
Robert was ready to use his martial arts (Picture: Marvel, The Howard Stern Show, Sirius XM)

Robert Downey Jr didn’t get the warmest reception when he arrived for his interview with Howard Stern this week, as the actor got into a verbal altercation with a Hollywood executive.

The 54-year-old, who famously played Iron Man in the Marvel Cinematic Universe, stopped by The Howard Stern Show on Monday for Sirius XM to launch their new Los Angeles studios.

But before he even sat down with the notorious shock jock, Robert got into a heated exchange while waiting in the green room.

Robert was simply watching the show on the TV screen prior to his interview, when a Hollywood bigwig barked at him to move out of the way.

Recalling the shocking incident, Robert later told Howard: ‘I was just standing out there … standing in front of the TV screen when this little nebbish big-wig says, “Out of the way!”’

When the actor explained that he and his team were simply watching the show, the bigwig replied: “Who the f**k are you?”’

Blimey, who is seriously brave enough to take on Iron Man?!

Rob didn’t get the warmest welcome at Howard Stern’s show (Picture: FilmMagic)

While speaking to Howard about the clash, Robert laughed it off and joked that he thought he was going to ‘have to light this guy up’.

According to Robert, the executive was of a ‘certain status … [people who] are the master of their environment’, which says it all.

Howard then joked that Robert ‘could have killed’ the exec with his martial arts skills.

Luckily, it didn’t get that serious.

We’d love to know who was brave enough to take on Iron Man (Picture: Marvel/Walt Disney Pictures/Kobal/REX)

In other Robert news, fans have launched a petition to push Disney to add the actor to their Oscars consideration list after they noticed he wasn’t put forward for a best actor nomination.

Robert has played Tony Stark since the first Iron Man movie – and the first MCU film at that – in 2008, but he made his last appearance as the beloved superhero in Avengers: Endgame.

The petition reads: ‘We, the undersigned, were so moved by Mr. Robert Downey Jr.’s performance as Tony Stark in Avengers: Endgame that we believe he is unquestionably deserving of the Academy’s Award for Best Actor.

‘The creative choices he made and immense depth of emotional energy he infused in Tony Stark forged an unforgettable experience for the viewers.’

Good luck, guys.
